chatroom

Class dataEncrypt

  • java.lang.Object
    • chatroom.dataEncrypt

  • public final class dataEncrypt
extends java.lang.Object
    Can encrypt text, decrypt text, generate key pairs, hash passwords

        The string of the encrypted bytes

                                    javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        Doubly encrypts a string of text to be sent to the server
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the encrypted string
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException

      • decryptBytes

        public byte[] decryptBytes(java.lang.String string)
                    throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                           javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                           javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        Decrypts a string twice, Once with the users private key. Then the first char in the partially decrypted string is the int value of the public key that should be used to decrypt the message fully. This will return an error if the correct public key does not exist in the public key dictionary.
        Parameters:
        string - The doubly encrypted string that the user received.
        Returns:
        the decrypted data in byte array format
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException

      • decryptText

        public java.lang.String decryptText(java.lang.String msg)
                             throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                    javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                    javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                                    java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Decrypts a string twice, Once with the users private key. Then the first char in the partially decrypted string is the int value of the public key that should be used to decrypt the message fully. This will return an error if the correct public key does not exist in the public key dictionary.
        Parameters:
        msg - the doubly encrypted string that the user received.
        Returns:
        the decrypted data in string format.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

        Converts a public key to a string, used when sending public key to server.

        Throws:

      • stringToPublicKey

        public static java.security.PublicKey stringToPublicKey(java.lang.String key)
                                                 throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Convert a string to a public key, used when getting a public key from the server
        Parameters:
        key - string from the server
        Returns:
        public key after conversion
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if missing library
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if key was not created using the same type, version error

      • getEncryptedPassword

        public static byte[] getEncryptedPassword(java.lang.String password,
                                          java.lang.String salt)
                                   throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                          java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Hashes a password from string, not sure if really useful...
        Parameters:
        password - raw password
        salt - string to add to password, room name
        Returns:
        byte array of the hashed password
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if missing a library
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - shouldn't be a problem
